unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The ambitious smart meter rollout across India is progressing steadily, with significant advancements reported in various states. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is playing a crucial role in facilitating this transition under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS).
normalised: New Delhi, India – The ambitious smart meter rollout across India is progressing steadily, with significant advancements reported in various states. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (E E S L) is playing a crucial role in facilitating this transition under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S).

unnormalised: Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) has recently accelerated its deployment plans, aiming to install smart meters in major cities like Lucknow and Kanpur by 31/12/2024. This initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, a persistent challenge in the sector.
normalised: Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (U P P C L) has recently accelerated its deployment plans, aiming to install smart meters in major cities like Lucknow and Kanpur by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. This initiative aims to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, a persistent challenge in the sector.

unnormalised: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has also announced a tender for the procurement of an additional 2 million smart meters, with the deadline for submissions set for 17/07/2024. The project is expected to improve billing efficiency and enhance consumer awareness regarding energy consumption.
normalised: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) has also announced a tender for the procurement of an additional two million smart meters, with the deadline for submissions set for seventeenth july two thousand and twenty four. The project is expected to improve billing efficiency and enhance consumer awareness regarding energy consumption.

unnormalised: "Smart meters are crucial for building a modern and efficient energy infrastructure," stated Dr. Sharma, Director of the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, during a seminar held at 10:00 hrs on 25/06/2024. The project also addresses challenges faced during peak demand, like during Diwali, and helps better grid management. The initiative hopes to make electricity accessible like "bijli roti makaan" for all.
normalised: "Smart meters are crucial for building a modern and efficient energy infrastructure," stated Doctor Sharma, Director of the Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi, during a seminar held at ten zero zero hours on twenty fifth june two thousand and twenty four. The project also addresses challenges faced during peak demand, like during Diwali, and helps better grid management. The initiative hopes to make electricity accessible like "bijli roti makaan" for all.
